reviews.review_msg: Wereha is entertaining, cynical, & thought-provoking. He spends more time challenging the material we are taught instead of repeating it to us verbatim. While his course is challenging, he presents a philosophical spin on his lessons, and if you have the capacity to stretch yourself intellectually & work hard, you will enjoy his class & succeed.

Two tests worth 40% and a paper worth 20%, so gg if you mess something up because there's almost no recovering. The written portions of tests are all based on lecs & his opinions, so don't even try to pull stuff from the text for info. Maybe this was on me, but the paper was super unclear & I ended up doing the whole thing wrong. Engaging guy tho.

Taking this class with Tyler was great! Lectures were interesting and it's nice that Tyler adds his own perspective on the generic stance the textbooks take. Gives you study questions that show up on the exam beforehand. Tyler's a funny guy - memes on every slide and interesting media supplements. HIGHLY recommend!

WARNING DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM. Everyone I talked to him strongly STRONGLY did not like him, and I did not either. He is a pompous ass. Honestly he's the type of guy to make his own reviews on here... I'm pretty sure all of the "excellent reviews" are from him...  He sucks. Too bad there isn't a "not respected by students" button

Tyler was a great instructor. He keeps lectures fun (even at 830 in the morning), records his lectures, and is always willing to discuss anything. Plays music in class, uses memes and photos in lecture slides, bases tests off of textbook but projects off of your own thoughts and beliefs. Pushes students to think critically about info in class

Best Professor I've had so far. Extremely passionate and interested in what he teaches and makes the material interesting to students as well. Does not just regurgitate material but rather looks for a more critical understanding of the course material. Absolutely hilarious which makes lectures more interesting & actually cares about his students.

Tyler is an interesting guy. He is pretty funny, but I kind of get confused by his humor tbh. I'm not sure what to take in as actual knowledge and what is just anecdotal. He is on his way to being a great professor!
He is amazing and the best prof i have met at SFU
Really awesome class! Tyler is super funny and is available to help you out with any questions.

HORRIBLE professor! The class material is quite interesting, but she does a horrendous job teaching it! Avoid her at all costs!  Horrid exams - over 200 multiple choice and over ten short answer questions in three hours (taken from test bank no less) test speed rather than knowledge! HATED this class.

An okay prof that doesn't really stand out. REALLY sticks to the textbook and basically repeats what the book says. Doesn't add anything to the lectures that you can't get from the book. Uses a test-bank for the exams. BEWARE FINAL EXAM IS HARD! 190 MC and 15 SA. Everyone was upset... I won't take her again.

Worst teacher ever. Her exams were RICKdiculously long and hard and she tested us specific details that require an incredible amount of studying. Very unfair midterms and finals. Avoid at all costs and i still remember at least half of the people doing their exams in the Shrum science building were still there after the alloted 3 hours.

Went to 3 lectures the entire semester and came out with an A+.  If you take this course, make better use of your time by reading the text during lecture time instead of actually going. Her lectures repeat the text book completely..sometimes word for word.
I'm probably going to have to retake this, a first for me. Dissapointing.

worst professor ever boring monotonous lectures with ridiculously long final. tiny little details were tested & they were completely irrelevant info that had one sentence in the text. it's easy to pull questions out from the text but it's hard for students to memorize every single little detail. final's length did not allow time to think abt answer
RUN!!!!!! RUN FOR YOUR LIFE! Worst class/grading/tests ever. Also, the TA was amazingly terrible. If you can take this elsewhere, do. If you can't, I'm very sorry.

BOOOOOOOORING. Also she seems nice, but a lazy teacher. All multiple choice questions have answers that could all be argued as the correct choice. Lectures are monotonous and oh so boring. Avoid if possible. Final was a massive number of multiple choice questions and short answers - too many for the time period allowed

Seems nice, but teaching apears lazy. Nearly all test questions are from the text, and VERY ambigious. 
 Example of a question: 
 -Educated women tend to see the role of females as:
 a-similar to males.
 b-having greater independence and achievement striving.
 c-less emotional.
 d-more competent.
 You could argue almost any answer. 
 
 Also- crappy

Nice guy! Listened to every lecture online - got an A+. You must put in the effort or you'll end up like some of the complainers here. He's more than fair - gives you answers for exam essay questions well in advance. Positive, upbeat attitude - nice person, EXTREMELY interesting material  (far more than I original anticipated). Great course!
Nice guy but he should really be teaching philosophy. Not a fan of his teaching style. Easy to nod off during class.
Amazing teacher.  Does not just teach material from the text but encourages students to question assumptions underlying the findings/theories.  Extremely nice and helpful, and very hot.

Very interesting teacher.  I feel he has a lot to offer, but is very egocentric in his teaching style.  He goes deep in an idea where you are extremely confused and have to memorize his exact words without understanding what you are writing about.  I wish he would simplify because I feel I could learn a lot more from him.
Nice prof, boring lengthy lectures, and easy exam (pretold of the essay part).

Like mentioned below, he is a very nice guy but his classes are a tad boring. Incorporation of a lot philosophy- not my style. Very fair on the tests because he gives study questions and picks the exam questions from these- but they are not easy! and incorporate the philosophy aspect of the course.  Talks a lot and never gets through all material.
he tries his best to make the class interactive, very nice and approachable guy. i found him boring despite this, but overall awsome prof.
Overall a very nice prof. He gives big hints for the exam.
Nice prof. Very funny. Make sure you do the study questions before exams.

Racine seems truly committed to students' success. Classes are engaging and he does encourage critical thinking, even if it's a little slanted to his own biases! Intelligent man, good teacher. I'm still undecided as to whether his is simply a biting sense of humour or if there may be a need for a bit of humility and grace...

Love the class i would another class if schedule permits     Always answers questions and attentive to the needs of students and very competent in teaching ability, I had a good time learning about the various ideas and theories regarding child development and the factors that influence it.

This prof presents a lot of the information through a very narrow biased lense while claiming that he's being objective. That said, he does encourage students to critically examine everything. He's very helpful if you don't understand something, and the WebCT discussions are great!
Course not quite what I expect, but test and paper fair and pretty easy. Prof pretty nice and spends lot of time on WebCT discussion site. Helpful guy. Good course.
Love his big chops and the irresistable curly hair
I didn't feel he went off topic.  He is very nice, 1 midterm 1 paper 1 final. Paper was simple, 5 pgs on any child topic. I'd still recommend him to my friends, hes not bad.

Tests are fair. I can't stand how he rants on about the same thing over and over.. He spent half our lecture reiterating criteria for our paper.. Lectures possibly waste of time.. And  lectures notes are unclear.. Just read the textbook and you'll be fine
Too much reading. Funny guy. Lecturing style unclear. Goes on tangents. Sarcastic humour that sometimes goes too far and makes you question whether or not he's kidding.

Dr. Kline is a pretty good teacher! I liked the class but I felt that the group project was unnecessary. The TA's gave the worst feedback that didn't help my group at all. I would take another class with her as long as her grading scale is different! A 77 was a fail; kind of shocking. Overall, she was a good teacher, very sweet and approachable!

She's an okay prof.. however doesn't provide clear rubrics + instructions for her students to follow. Her and the TA's marking is horrible and every time my group members and I asked for help.. their feedback was not reliable and made us lose even more marks the only good thing is her study guides for the exams, as they were quite identical.

The grading scale in this class is really intense. The C- starts at a 77% and the A+ is 98%. She omits one of the exams, but being a 80% student it did not help. If you miss one class you will go done a letter grade as she has in class assignments. The group project for this class is fairly easy but worth a lot of marks.

Michelle was rotating a lozenge in her mouth while lecturing basically the entire semester. Unexpected ASMR. Overall, an easy course. Her method of teaching makes you learn a lot. She doesn't curve the grades, however grading scales for this class are extremely difficult, therefore it's really hard to get A's. U fail this class if u skip it
Strong feminist vibes. The criteria for this class is a bit skewed but provides study guides pre-exam which are kind of nice.
Her grading criteria was so high. I was doing good at everything but ended up with a low grade because her grading system was so high :(

Dr. Kline was a great professor. Her use of videos and online content made it really engaging. However, group the group project was A LOT of work so be prepared to do group assignments every week. She prepped us for exams with study guides which were great.

Dr. Kline is amazing! Seems daunting at the beginning when you look at how your graded and the work you need to put in, but once your in the swing of it, it's quite doable. Make sure to establish group boundaries at the beginning of the semester! the study guides should be mandatory to do before exams!!!!!!!! USE THEM TO GUIDE YOU THROUGH THE TEXT!

Dr Kline is a great prof! Highly recommend! She has a clear outline of how you are graded in the course. Its 3 midterms, lowest grade omitted, that you are well prepared for, and a final group project. She teaches note taking and studying tips and tricks that can be used in other classes. She's experienced in the field and knows what she's doing.

Lectures are a joke; 90 percent is just her showing videos from free sources like Youtube, Khan Academy, and TED talks. She could have saved the time of us coming to campus by just cancelling lectures and giving us a list of videos to watch. Course was very easy; one large group project that is an easy 10/10. 3 exams, only best 2 count. No final.

lectures were disorganized and rarely posted on time. lectures also sometimes referenced information from the old textbook (?) instead of the textbook assigned at the beginning of the semester. the textbook was really difficult to get through, literally like walls upon walls of text. i didn't enjoy it and recommend avoiding classes with her.
Disorganized lectures, awful textbook, and unclear rubrics. avoid this course if you can. Dr. Broesch is kind, but not a good professor

Not bad. Her lectures are interesting and she seems very passionate about her work. The exams are fair and based on her lectures and some of the textbook. She gives out great study guides so i recommend you do those. The only problem I had with this class was that the lecture were in a weird format that made it hard to take notes.

She doesn't post the lectures on time and the lectures drone on about information not relevant to what we need to learn. I have to teach myself from a textbook that is honestly all over the place when it comes to information. I truly regret taking this course online, but it was the only option offered.

Dr.Broesch was unorganized and her lectures was nothing compared to the textbook. The textbook was OVERWHElMING! Our assignment paper was just unnecessary. We had to write about some vague topics for about 8 pages! Overall I did not enjoy this class. Try to take this course with anyone but her.
i did not enjoy this class at all. That's it. It was extremely unorganized for an online class. The rest of the reviews can speak for me.

Professor & TA's knowledge/views don't align. I think the course is designed to make the professor's life easy, not the students. Lectures have minimal information and mainly discuss how interesting the course is...You have to teach yourself most of the material. Would not recommend Tanya at all. Some people should stick to research, and not teach.

Lectures were the very basic of textbook content. The format of it was annoying too. You essentially teach yourself EVERYTHING. But, she did give us study guides for the exams which were super helpful. The exams were fair and the class averages was pretty high. Not the worst and not the best!

For a distance education course, I do not think she did a great job. She never posts her lecture on time and her lectures are not even helpful at all. The essay is easy but this course is test-heavy. 30% for paper, 30% for midterm and 40% for final. At least she is nice I guess...

Idk why she has any good ratings.Lectures ALWAYS late w/ no communication.Had to combine lectures & upload on the last day of semester to fit everything.Qs not clear which one is essay or SA, but 2 essays/exam.Can't move btwn Qs.0 respect for students time. Slides are useless pictures but exams are lecture heavy.MT30 % final 40% w/ 90mins, 1paper.

An amazing mentor and professor, this class was easy but engaging and I looked forward to it every week! Not only this but the final assignment was a blast and I was given all the tools to complete it to the best of my ability! Would take again :)

Lack of concrete and crystal clear instructions for essay assignment. The course itself isn't too hard, but she and her TAs gave different accounts (in writing!) as to what was to be expected of us for the final project. Tanya says the length is 8 pages. The TA says there's an 8 page max, inferring you can write less than 8 pages. Which one is it?

Terrible. Lectures were disorganized and just recited the textbook with a few of her own studies thrown in when vaguely relevant. Term paper worth 30% of final had unclear instructions: very little actual teaching here. I ended up just taking notes from textbook and checking slides for anything new. She puts zero effort into her class and it shows.

Her online lectures were very disorganized and bland, she just reads off the powerpoints so there is really no point in listening to her pre-recorded lectures. Majority of her exam material comes from the textbook. In general, the course just seemed disorganized and unclear.

Tanya's delivery in lectures are a little unprepared though she is aware of this and tries to improve her self. She's extremely knowledgeable about child development, and has a pretty good sense of humour. Don't dread about the lectures as most of the material you learn and get tested on is from the textbook.

Her lectures are all over the place. She expects her students to be psychic on the exams and is not direct about what she wants. If you don't mention the study she is thinking, it is wrong. Exam Qs were subjective (eg "what is the coolest study?"). She needs more practice. Class of 200+ did poorly on midterm short answer and she took no ownership.

Okay, I took this class thinking "Wow I am super interested in this, I want to work with youths, this will be a great course!" I no longer even want to have kids later in life thanks to her. - 3 hour lectures with 4 hours worth of info, disorganized, bad speaker, 50% of slides are useless, anecdotes instead of precision, even her TAs were dull.

Tanya is a really nice prof, and is obviously passionate about what she teaches. Unfortunately, she's just not a very good teacher. More often than not, she can't answer your questions, and she has trouble clearly explaining concepts in her OWN lectures; it feels as if she's winging it most of the time. You can tell she cares about her class though

Dr. Broesch is very enthused and knowledgeable about her content, but her lecture slides aren't very informative.  Most of the required material comes from what's in the textbook. She skips a lot of slides, which don't have much info on them anyways. Textbook is very important for exams, in conjunction with examples and case studies in lecture

I got to say she is SUCH A NICE PERSON! i showed up late to the midterm today (start@8:30-10:30am, I arrived @ 10am) she just handed me the exam and ask if an hour would be enough to complete it, was not mad at all and even offer extra time for completion. Although sometimes she forget to upload slides and a little unorganized, still a nice prof !

Tanya is a great person. Hence the word "person" because she is not very good at teaching. She skips most slides, and for most questions she says "Good question, but I don't know the answer." The class is very easy, and she focuses on the main issues in development without going into much detail. Still, she is a very nice person...

Although she is a very nice person, she's not a very organized prof. Her slides are all over the place, and sometimes she forgets to upload them completely. Lectures are sometimes interesting and she gives hints about the exams, but you can just read the textbook. Instructions for assignments aren't always 100% clear, but exams are more than fair.

I felt like we were always running out of time becuase she talks about certain slides for a really long time, then ends up skipping so many other slides because of lack of time. However, she is passionate about the topic and shows the class interesting videos . I wouldn't recommend this class to my friends though...

If you read the textbook and go to lectures this is an easy A.  Tanya is very passionate about the subject, and gets feedback from the class on her teaching so she can improve if people don't like something.

Honestly just read the textbook and you will be fine. Yes her lectures are unnecessarily long and she tends to be unclear and ramble sometimes BUT she's only talking about what's in the book. She really wants you to remember the main general themes for the short answer on the exam, and the mc portion is from the textbook. Overall, easy A.

I don't know what the others are talking about. I came to see her after class and during office hours and she was really nice and helpful. She got me interested in psychology and I would definitely recommend taking this class. You need to read the slides and go to lecture.

Lecture organization and time management could have been better, otherwise Tanya is a very fair professor. Iclicker questions, midterm, and final were easy...and I studied last minute for all of them.

Tanya is definitely knowledgeable in her field and has conducted quite a few interesting studies.  Her lectures were a longer than they should have been (usually finished at the 2 hour mark) and sometimes hard to follow.  Overall, interesting/applicable class and I feel she'll get better as teacher with more experience :)

The class covers alot of material. She presented it in a fun way - asking questions. Sometimes there was too much emphasis on critical thinking and groupwork, but I liked the lecture style overall. I'd recommend it.

She has good intentions, but I found her lectures to be disorganized as she would often flip between slides. She didn't spend enough time on the actual content of the course. It was otherwise spent on "group work" and unnecessary questions/answers by the same people. However, she did use some interesting videos. Overall, I have mixed feelings.
I thought she was helpful and passionate about the topic and she made class enjoyable.

She is definitely a nice person, and tries to make lectures interesting. However, she sometimes gets confused, and I get confused too. She talks so fast, that it is difficult to make notes during lectures. It's better to get lecture records online and study by yourself unless there is no i clicker quizz.

I enjoyed the course but found Tanya incredibley difficult and intimidating to approach. The few times I came to her with questions I felt she was condescending and rude, eventually I just stopped asking questions.

I have had three classes with Sherrie. She is very direct, engaging in lectures and LOVES to share personal stories. Her classes are typically 2-3 midterms (non-cumulative) and an assignment. On her tests the multiple choice is pretty easy and short answer can be difficult/require you to write a lot for full marks.

Taken 2 classes w/ Sherrie and she uses dry humour that may not come across to everybody but, she is very fair in her grading and drops your lowest exam mark (3 exams + 1 project). Topics are interesting and involves participation from the class, it is important to attend lectures (not recorded). She tells you exactly what will be on the exams.

Dr. Atwood is a very caring person and gives of herself with personal examples to help you learn the material. There is a lot of info in this class with only a few topics, so she expects you to understand a deeper meaning and tests accordingly. If you care enough and learn that deeper meaning you will do fine. I really enjoyed the class.

Takes too long to go over lecture when half the time she rambles. Tests started out ok but progressively got more difficult, pulled questions from very specific moments in lecture so attendance is mandatory if you want to do well. TAs are always late to return exams for review before the next (you can't look at an exam once the next has begun)

Interesting content, poor delivery and testing methods. Studied my butt off for an exam and got 60%, not studying I got 90% -  succeeding is not a matter of knowing course content, but how well you can answer very specific and random questions that are worded confusingly. Saw another course with Sherrie, looks so cool, but will avoid - shame.

Prof rambles for the whole three hours, but could shorten if she didn't. She goes through around 5 slides every hour and rambles about them. Class is exam heavy and would take so long to get back to us, each exam consists of around 5 - 7 short answer questions. Doesn't reply to emails.

You will fail if you don't go to class considering majority of exam questions are on specific conversations (both relevant to material and not) held in class. Lectures are unnecessarily long. Exams are frustrating and unfair. TAs take so long to grade exams, you do not have time to review exam before next one. Don't recommend.
lecture for psyc 250 is 3 hours long but could seriously be shortened to 2 hours MAX if she didn't ramble on about pointless things

Do not take this class for an elective. Complete opposite of a GPA booster. She's a good lecturer, however her exams are insanely difficult and almost the entire final grade is based off of the marks you get on these exams. Really interesting material though.

I really liked Sherrie as a person - she uses personal anecdotes for course material and I found her to be funny. The TAs mostly marked our assignments and tests so I can't really speak to that, but the assignment criteria was fairly clear. Final grade was based on 3 midterms and 3 assignments. If you put in the effort, you will do well!

Dr. Atwood has probably the most entertaining lectures of any prof. She tells lots of stories of her own kids and her own life experiences, and invites lots of questions and comments and it makes for a very entertaining lecture! The assignments are short and interesting. Exams are kind of hard. Need to do a lot of memorizing to get an A.

Sherri's lectures are quite messy and disorganized. You legit have to read and memorize the textbook word for word to be able to answer some of the exam questions. Even misc facts like the % of people who got a certain disease in 1982.
Super engaging prof, always making lectures interesting and fun. Exams and assignments were fair.

she is amazing if you just sit and listen to her in class then you will clearly not need a textbook even if it is required for the course. She doesn't ever bring material outside the textbook and all her exams are multiple choice. Not so easy A but multiple choice should give you at least B and above

I wouldn't recommend taking classes with Sherrie before going back to in-person life. Her online classes are extremely messy comparing with those on normal days. Her lectures cover few materials from the textbook and even the orders are messed up. Redundant and boring recording lectures...

SHE IS WONDERFUL. TAKE COURSE WITH HER, YOU CAN EASILY GET A. I HAVE DONE ALL THE PSYCHOLOGY COURSES FROM HER AND GOT A+ IN ALL. HER TESTS ARE SUPER EASY, ASSIGNMENTS ARE EASY. OVERALL, PSYCHOLOGY WITH SHERRIE IS A GPA BOOSTER...:)

super straightforward prof, always lays out everything at the beginning of the semester, & sticks to her promises. no final exams usually, just 4 midterms based off a couple chapters at a time. she has a twisted sense of humour that not many ppl understand/appreciate & tends to overshare about her personal life which just makes u like her more tbh

Course itself was relatively easy. Exams were easy enough if you listened to her lectures as well as read required material. TAs were a little hard on marking assignments and didn't provide feedback. Sherrie is just damn mean though. She was rude and incredibly stressful to have to deal with outside of class.

Sherrie is a great prof and very consistent. Once you get the hang of her teaching and evaluation style, her class is very enjoyable and not overly stressful. She was also very funny and really tried to relate the material to the students. Assignments were not very difficult as long as you are up to date in the course.

Honestly, students that are saying she is awful, really did not take the time to read her detailed syllabus - where it CLEARLY says, don't take it with her if you don't like her style. Also, ripping on the TAs is absolutely not fair as when I talked to them both, they were so helpful and went above and beyond to assist me etc. Try talking to them!

very disorganized class, get ready to teach yourself in the course. exams were all multiple choice didn't learn anything from them. The prof/ TA's were unavailable for feedback on assignments and they took forever to put grades up which made it hard to know where you stand in the course. dont take unless you need with this prof.

The lectures are long, boring, and all over the place. The information is hard to follow at times and the grading criteria for the assignments is not clear. Despite this, Sherrie is kind and caring, and the exams are not too difficult (just pay attention to the readings and lectures!)

Took it with her during remote learning and i had a hard time because she was disorganized. Her exams are a mix of textbook, lecture recordings and lecture notes. Personally it was a lot of info to retain and some items in the exams were so specific. If youre good at retaining info down to the smallest detail, youll be fine

Sherrie is an ok prof. She doesn't seem like she enjoys teaching which makes the learning environment a bit meh.... Her tests are all multiple choice which is convenient for online learning. I probably wouldn't take a class with her again just due to her vibe but she wasn't awful.

Her lecture notes and exam questions are so illogical and ambiguous that you'll have to read them 5 times over just to try and comprehend what they're saying. She includes material on the exam that is not covered in the text or in the lecture. There is no clear grading criteria for assignmentsTAs mark hard.

Lectures are so different from the readings, sometimes even unrelated. When she says something is excluded in the test, its included. Grading is very rigidyou either finish it on time or its a zero. Doesnt believe in assignment rubrics. ALSO, her Canvas setup is so disorganized: so many tabs for no good reason.

Very cold to her students but will help out when you ask. Tests include topics she talks about in class that are not in the textbook and notes. As well as many questions about the videos we watch in class. Her exams are not toooo difficult and are all multiple choice.

Sherrie is incredibly unprofessional and could not care less about her students and the marks they receive. She frequently says she will not test certain material and then it appeared on exams. Her ambiguous grading criteria for papers and TAs who also don't care leaves you with a very heavy class about 101 ways babies die. I wouldn't recommend.

Lectures arent very helpful at adding to the content and wouldnt be necessary except she shows videos and tests directly on the videos and doesnt upload them on Canvas. Shes very disorganized but the course isnt difficult overall. In class assignments are a bit of a mess.

her lectures go by so fast and since most of the content was lecture based I had alot of trouble with the exams. Even after finishing the course i still dont know if the textbook was useful because for me it was not but some questions were textbook claimed to be text book based but I never read them in the textbook. Good lecturer though, fast tho

You better remember the children's names from the videos she shows in class, they're on the exam like, "In Luna's video, we saw that...." If you don't remember, well good luck! Textbook is long and boring and barely anything is tested from it. The chances are you'll do better just studying lecture slides, than just the textbook.

One of my absolute favourite profs at SFU. Her lectures are interesting and funny but full of information (make sure you take notes on videos shown too!). She's really easygoing and kind. Exams are fair, and in class assignments are not difficult if you went to lecture. They're also an easy way to improve your mark (worth 40%). Overall a good prof.

Average level of difficulty, lectures are the main focus of exams, lots of textbook notes. She is quite disorganized which is both annoying and stressful but this doesn't seem to negatively impact grading. If you're looking for a standard PSYC course that won't make you cry, she's a good choice.

Wonderful prof & human being. Lectures were interesting & class group work was easy & a grade booster if you take time to do it well! Definitely read the textbook, know facts & studies for the midterms/exam.

Her lectures were mostly entertaining. I found the first 2 exams difficult due to very specific questions about exact percentages and some were repetitive. Although there were a few questions about the videos and comments other students made during lecture, reading the textbook is a must. The last exam was a joke if you read the textbook.
She is alright. She is a very chill prof. She doesn't seem to like answering questions after class.  But it was an easy course.

Sherrie is an amazing prof, her three hour lectures for developmental psychology were engaging!! Although the textbook was optional I found it very helpful if I didn't understand, or wished to read further into a lecture topic. Sure she gets off topic and ends lecture slightly early, but I never felt like she was leaving gaps in my learning.

Awesome prof. I don't know how people think this course or her exams are difficult, they are all multiple choice, common sense questions. Take a science course & you'll see what difficult is. This course was a cake walk. She's funny, engaging, and shows cool vids. Essay is a piece of cake. I really enjoyed this class w/ her. I'd take another w/ her

Dr. Atwood is very unorganized and not very interested in what she is teaching! Boring lecture, lags on forever. Exams are pretty hard. She tests mostly on powerpoint slides, but read the textbook as well. Textbook is fairly interesting but chapters are long. Put quite a bit of thought and information into the papers.

Sherrie is awesome! She only tests you on material gone over in lectures so attendance is important. It's easy to sit through 3 hours too, because she is so damn hilarious. A wicked sense of humor and easy to approach. Lots of videos and real like applications. The paper assignments are easy, just really give them thought and you'll do fine.

Great prof, very laidback & humorous. It's a simple class, just ATTEND LECTURE because she only tests on what she says. MT M/C was very easy, short answers all based on videos IN CLASS. Two easy "papers" (1 page each) worth 20% overall. I highly recommend Sherri, she's super fun and knowledgeable :)

Very easy going proff, who loves to make jokes. However, she isn't very good at explaining course material or answering questions. The midterm was too difficult! She says she is making the final easier =)

Super entertaining, Sherrie acts like a kid, she's very outspoken, robust, and natural. But with that comes a bit of disorganization, she tends to rant and fix things on her slides in the middle of lecture but she knows her stuff. Papers aren't hard, Exams are fair and content turned out to be pretty interesting.

Her lectures are interesting but prepare for regular tangents. I think how she takes an easy going perspective to her class is refreshing. The papers are a nice change from the traditional and a grade booster. For the exams be sure to add lots of detail for the short answer questions.

Do not take a class with her! Her lectures are very unorganized and it seems at times that she has no idea what she is talking about. Her exams are very challenging as she asks questions that she briefly spoke about during class!

Loved her sense of humour and organization of course. Keeps things interesting, doesn't rely completely on text (but still important to course). Clear & helpful. Really gives students a chance to do well. MC was fair to easy, but the short answers require A LOT of detail. Great course, look forward to taking 358 with her.

I don't know if I've ever had a professor as interested in their material as her.  She definitely makes the class interesting and fun, and she doesn't test on anything but what's covered in class so basically attend and you're golden. I highly recommend this prof!

She is an awesome prof! She has a great sense of humour and the lectures are always interesting. Attenind lectures is a MUST as anything on the midterm and finals is only based on what she has said in lecture. She stayed true to what she said, and the midterm and final were easy. We did in class papers which were easy as well. Overall, great class!
